instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2838: What is 820-2838? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Internal Display
threads.message:
Hello,

Macbook had corrosion on or near internal dp connector and J4700. Cleaned up pins of J4700. Replaced edp connector with a new part. Macbook boots and shows external display, all seems to be working except for internal display.

Is not a backlight issue, checked for image and tested with known good display.

Checked <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>, 3.4 volts and voltage drops when magnet is applied to the lid switch.

Any thoughts?

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Internal Display
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Internal Display
threads.message: Bad soldering on the connector, bad LCD cable, corroded trace from connector to the eDP caps.
